@title ERC20 interface

attributes.name: ERC20

attributes.documentation:
@title SafeMath
@dev Math operations with safety checks that revert on error
attributes.name: SafeMath

attributes.documentation: @dev Multiplies two numbers, reverts on overflow.
attributes.name: mul

attributes.documentation: @dev Integer division of two numbers truncating the quotient, reverts on division by zero.
attributes.name: div

attributes.documentation: @dev Subtracts two numbers, reverts on overflow (i.e. if subtrahend is greater than minuend).
attributes.name: sub

attributes.documentation: @dev Adds two numbers, reverts on overflow.
attributes.name: add

attributes.documentation:
@dev Divides two numbers and returns the remainder (unsigned integer modulo),
reverts when dividing by zero.
attributes.name: mod

attributes.documentation:
@dev The Ownable constructor sets the original `owner` of the contract to the sender
account.
@dev Throws if called by any account other than the owner.
attributes.name: onlyOwner
renounceOwnership

attributes.documentation:
@dev Allows the current owner to transfer control of the contract to a newOwner.
@param _newOwner The address to transfer ownership to.
attributes.name: transferOwnership

attributes.documentation:
@dev Transfers control of the contract to a newOwner.
@param _newOwner The address to transfer ownership to.
attributes.name: _transferOwnership
HasNoEther

attributes.documentation:
@dev Constructor that rejects incoming Ether
The `payable` flag is added so we can access `msg.value` without compiler warning. If we
leave out payable, then Solidity will allow inheriting contracts to implement a payable
constructor. By doing it this way we prevent a payable constructor from working. Alternatively
we could use assembly to access msg.value.
@dev Disallows direct send by setting a default function without the `payable` flag.
@dev Transfer all Ether held by the contract to the owner.
attributes.name: reclaimEther
SafeERC20
CanReclaimToken

attributes.documentation:
@dev Reclaim all ERC20 compatible tokens
@param _token ERC20 The address of the token contract
attributes.name: reclaimToken
HasNoTokens
tokenFallback
HasNoContracts

attributes.documentation:
@dev Reclaim ownership of Ownable contracts
@param _contractAddr The address of the Ownable to be reclaimed.
attributes.name: reclaimContract
NoOwner

attributes.documentation: @dev Constructor that gives msg.sender all of existing tokens.
